description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 6d6 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save con 15 format=long]] or be &Reference[stunned]{stunned} until the end of the empyrean’s next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Ranged Spell Attack: +15 to hit, range 600 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 7d6 average=true]] damage of one of the following types (empyrean’s choice): &Reference[acid]{acid}, &Reference[cold]{cold}, &Reference[fire]{fire}, &Reference[force]{force}, &Reference[lightning]{lightning}, &Reference[radiant]{radiant}, or &Reference[thunder]{thunder}.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

The empyrean can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The empyrean regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Attack. The empyrean makes one attack.

Bolster. The empyrean bolsters all nonhostile creatures within 120 feet of it until the end of its next turn. Bolstered creatures can’t be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} or &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, and they gain advantage on ability checks and saving throws until the end of the empyrean’s next turn.

Trembling Strike (Costs 2 Actions). The empyrean strikes the ground with its maul, triggering an earth tremor. All other creatures on the ground within 60 feet of the empyrean must succeed on a [[/save str 25 format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The empyrean makes one attack.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The empyrean bolsters all nonhostile creatures within 120 feet of it until the end of its next turn. Bolstered creatures can’t be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} or &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, and they gain advantage on ability checks and saving throws until the end of the empyrean’s next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The empyrean strikes the ground with its maul, triggering an earth tremor. All other creatures on the ground within 60 feet of the empyrean must succeed on a [[/save str 25 format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Innate Spellcasting. The empyrean’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 23, +15 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

At will: greater restoration, pass without trace, water breathing, water walk

1/day each: commune, dispel evil and good, earthquake, &Reference[fire]{fire} storm, plane shift (self only)

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If the empyrean fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Resistance. The empyrean has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Weapons. The empyrean’s weapon attacks are magical.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Alignment. The alignment of an Empyrean is chaotic good (75%) or neutral evil (25%).

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's &Reference[exhaustion]{exhaustion} level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

  • One effect that &Reference[charmed]{charmed} or &Reference[petrified]{petrified} the target
  • One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item
  • Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores
  • One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

A veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you (including you) has a +10 bonus to &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} (&Reference[ste]{Stealth}) checks and can't be tracked except by magical means. A creature that receives this bonus leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.
This spell grants up to ten willing creatures you can see within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

This spell grants the ability to move across any liquid surface--such as water, &Reference[acid]{acid}, mud, snow, quicksand, or lava--as if it were harmless solid ground (creatures crossing molten lava can still take damage from the heat). Up to ten willing creatures you can see within range gain this ability for the duration.

If you target a creature submerged in a liquid, the spell carries the target to the surface of the liquid at a rate of 60 feet per round.

You contact your deity or a divine proxy and ask up to three questions that can be answered with a yes or no. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for each question.

Divine beings aren't necessarily omniscient, so you might receive "unclear" as an answer if a question pertains to information that lies beyond the deity's knowledge. In a case where a one-word answer could be misleading or contrary to the deity's interests, the GM might offer a short phrase as an answer instead.

If you cast the spell two or more times before finishing your next long rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer. The GM makes this roll in secret.

Shimmering energy surrounds and protects you from &Reference[fey]{fey}, &Reference[undead]{undead}, and creatures originating from beyond the &Reference[material]{Material} Plane. For the duration, celestials, elementals, &Reference[fey]{fey}, fiends, and &Reference[undead]{undead} have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

You can end the spell early by using either of the following special functions.

Break &Reference[enc]{Enchantment}. As your action, you touch a creature you can reach that is &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, or possessed by a &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, an &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, a &Reference[fey]{fey}, a &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, or an &Reference[undead]{undead}. The creature you touch is no longer &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, or possessed by such creatures.

Dismissal. As your action, make a melee spell attack against a &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, an &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, a &Reference[fey]{fey}, a &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, or an &Reference[undead]{undead} you can reach. On a hit, you attempt to drive the creature back to its home plane. The creature must succeed on a &Reference[cha]{Charisma} saving throw or be sent back to its home plane (if it isn't there already). If they aren't on their home plane, &Reference[undead]{undead} are sent to the Shadowfell, and &Reference[fey]{fey} are sent to the Feywild.

You create a seismic disturbance at a point on the ground that you can see within range. For the duration, an intense tremor rips through the ground in a 100-foot-radius circle centered on that point and shakes creatures and structures in contact with the ground in that area.

The ground in the area becomes difficult terrain. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's &Reference[concentration]{concentration} is broken.

When you cast this spell and at the end of each turn you spend concentrating on it, each creature on the ground in the area must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

This spell can have additional effects depending on the terrain in the area, as determined by the GM.

Fissures. Fissures open throughout the spell's area at the start of your next turn after you cast the spell. A total of 1d6 such fissures open in locations chosen by the GM. Each is 1d10 × 10 feet deep, 10 feet wide, and extends from one edge of the spell's area to the opposite side. A creature standing on a spot where a fissure opens must succeed on a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure's edge as it opens.

A fissure that opens beneath a structure causes it to automatically collapse (see below).

Structures. The tremor deals 50 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage to any structure in contact with the ground in the area when you cast the spell and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends. If a structure drops to 0 hit points, it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures. A creature within half the distance of a structure's height must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 5d6 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage, is knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}, and is buried in the rubble, requiring a DC 20 &Reference[str]{Strength} (&Reference[ath]{Athletics}) check as an action to escape. The GM can adjust the DC higher or lower, depending on the &Reference[nat]{nature} of the rubble. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall &Reference[prone]{prone} or become buried.

A storm made up of sheets of roaring flame appears in a location you choose within range. The area of the storm consists of up to ten 10-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each &Reference[cube]{cube} must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another &Reference[cube]{cube}. Each creature in the area must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. It takes 7d10 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The &Reference[fire]{fire} damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried. If you choose, &Reference[plant]{plant} life in the area is unaffected by this spell.

system.chatFlavor: [7d10 - fire] Can choose to not affect plants in the area

description.value:
Special Notes: self only.

You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Plane of &Reference[fire]{Fire} or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination. If you are trying to reach the City of Brass, for example, you might arrive in its Street of Steel, before its Gate of Ashes, or looking at the city from across the Sea of &Reference[fire]{Fire}, at the GM's discretion.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

You can use this spell to banish an unwilling creature to another plane. Choose a creature within your reach and make a melee spell attack against it. On a hit, the creature must make a &Reference[cha]{Charisma} saving throw. If the creature fails this save, it is transported to a random location on the plane of existence you specify. A creature so transported must find its own way back to your current plane of existence.
